title: Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial: History & Culture
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture             History & Culture         President Roosevelt's statue as seen in the Third Term room. NPS PHOTO  Visit the Ranger Journal Blog for articles about this and other memorials in the National Mall and Memorial Parks! Franklin Roosevelt remains intimately connected to the National Park Service. During a speech in 1936, President Roosevelt noted the special quality of national parks by stating that "there is nothing so American." He captured the essential truth of the agency by declaring, "the fundamental idea behind the parks...is that the country belongs to the people, that it is in process of making for the enrichment of the lives of all of us."   Places Stories
